title: imlosthehe
author: imlosthehe
created_time: November 28, 2023, 07:03:05 PMLast edit: November 30, 2023, 08:26:19 PM by imlosthehe
content: Hello. I need some help; I'm not sure if its the place, but I'll post it here since my transactions started from an Electrum walletI've send 0.05 BTC from my electrum to my Hardwallet, but I received just 0.0025 there. I can't find the rest of it; Any idea what happened??* I was testing the HW, I sent the sats back from the HW to the electrum wallet, the 0.0025, and I got it back, excluding the tax ofc. I mean, where is the rest of the first transaction ?      edit  - - txid =     6fd52678efc0fbd427f698d1550fad0b77e5348772711555cc582e774d556e08

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You need  to let us know the txid of the first transaction before this question can be answered. Txid is the Transaction ID.

comments.author: imlosthehe
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 28, 2023, 07:05:01 PMYou need  to let us know the txid of the first transaction before this question can be answered. Txid is the Transaction ID. srytxid =    6fd52678efc0fbd427f698d1550fad0b77e5348772711555cc582e774d556e08

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: imlosthehe on November 28, 2023, 07:56:20 PM6fd52678efc0fbd427f698d1550fad0b77e5348772711555cc582e774d556e08Are you sure this is the transaction you are talking about?In the transaction in question 0.05 BTC was sent to 3BwYFVunGWNScpeskEUHjAv7BesM9AEMEC. Does this address belong to your hardware wallet?In OP, you said that you sent back the fund to your electrum wallet. The fund (which is 0.05 BTC) hasn't been moved from that address and is still there.

Does this address belong to your hardware wallet?In OP, you said that you sent back the fund to your electrum wallet. The fund (which is 0.05 BTC) hasn't been moved from that address and is still there. Yes, , I'll check again the IDhttps://i.ibb.co/0YNfpJR/image.png-0,05 is the transaction from elect to HW+0.0023 is the transaction back from HW to elec (all the balance I could see there) 6fd52678efc0fbd427f698d1550fad0b77e5348772711555cc582e774d556e0816b0de4473efd87d9c81d1ebf71c3e64a46eb80102f8557c2b28ca9a865dc2c1both txID. I was trying to send smth to the HW, then get it back to test it. it worked, but Icouldn't access all the balance in the proccess. It looks like I'm not able to access all the balance I was supposed to in the HW

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: The transaction sending 0.0023 (from your hardware wallet to your electrum wallet, as you say) has spent the fund received 2 months ago and has nothing to do with the transaction sending 0.05 BTC. As I said in my previous post, the 0.05 BTC hasn't been moved from 3BwYFVunGWNScpeskEUHjAv7BesM9AEMEC at all. Do you own 3BwYFVunGWNScpeskEUHjAv7BesM9AEMEC? If this address belongs to your hardware wallet, the fund is still there.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: What is the name of your hardware wallet? I guess it could be Ledger, and using it with Ledger Live. If it is Ledger Live, clear the cache or something. Or just connect the hardware wallet with Electrum.

comments.author: imlosthehe
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 28, 2023, 09:02:10 PMWhat is the name of your hardware wallet? I guess it could be Ledger, and using it with Ledger Live. If it is Ledger Live, clear the cache or something. Or just connect the hardware wallet with Electrum.It's keystone. I was using app on cellphone, watch only to see the balance.But,  WTF, I've just checked again, and now it's right, I can see the balance all OK. (I was refreshing it all day yesterday and today too, no ideia why it's right now; I checked it before starting the post here);It looks like it was a bug or something and the app had a delay...  no idea. Thank you again, it looks like you can solve problems just staring at them     Thank you P.S.  "The transaction sending 0.0023 (from your hardware wallet to your electrum wallet, as you say) has spent the fund received 2 months ago and has nothing to do with the transaction sending 0.05 BTC. "Man I have no idea what happened, both transactions I've made yesterday, the ones I've sent the printscreen, and I copied the  txID direct from them.Also, i've never used this HW before, I opened it maybe 2 months ago, when I bought, but the only transactions that I've made with it were those I've sent here with the printscreen. Anyway, something happened while I was here with you and now I can see the balance

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: imlosthehe on November 28, 2023, 09:17:06 PMIt's keystone. I was using app on cellphone, watch only to see the balance.But,  WTF, I've just checked again, and now it's right, I can see the balance all OK. (I was refreshing it all day yesterday and today too, no ideia why it's right now; I checked it before starting the post here);It looks like it was a bug or something and the app had a delay...  no idea.That's probably a bug in their app there is someone on Reddit who has a similar issue but he made the transaction from Coinbase to Keystone but according to him, it does not show any TXID on the Keystone transaction history. No update from him so I don't know if he already fixed the issue.Here's the Reddit post that I'm talking about below.- https://www.reddit.com/r/KeystoneWallet/comments/143nmgd/dont_see_sent_btc_on_keystone_app/?rdt=52654
